p: Near‐surface air temperature is one of the most direct experiences of weather and climate for people in their everyday life. Its short‐term variability and long‐term trend are thus among the most investigated topics in climate research (e.g., Ji et al., 2014; Jones, 1999; Jones et al., 2012; Legates & Willmott, 1990). Due to its location close to the interface between land/ocean and the atmosphere, the near‐surface air is impacted by various exchange processes between these three Earth system compartments.
